snippet: The case of Ryan Eisner leaves questions about why the drug that saved him failed with other patients.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines case of star college athlete Ryan Eisner of Queens, who survived sepsis after his doctors used a risky, controversial drug from Eli Lilly & Co to treat him in an advanced stage of sepsis; Eisner was not expected to recover, and the drug has since been pulled from the market because of its failure rate; Eisner's recovery remains a mystery.
lead_paragraph: The case of Ryan Eisner leaves questions about why the drug that saved him failed with other patients.

headline.seo: For Ryan Eisner, College Athlete, Narrow Escape From Sepsis Leaves a Mystery
headline.main: Athlete’s Near-Death From Sepsis, and His Mysterious Recovery
headline.print_headline: Athlete’s Near-Death From Sepsis, and His Mysterious Recovery
